attributes.action: Do not discriminate against the over 70 s by forcing isolation.
attributes.additional_details: It treats us as outcasts . Some of us run a business. Most of us went through the post war deprivation and the Cold War. We are not snowflakes.
attributes.background: This is a very bad idea and we should be allowed to choose for ourselves.

rejection.details:
The Government has not enforced self-isolation in a different way based on age.

On 16 March, when the Government advised people to avoid unnecessary contact, it said that this advice was particularly important for people over 70, for pregnant women and for those with some health conditions, but the advice was not enforced: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/pm-statement-on-coronavirus-16-march-2020

On 23 March the Government issued new advice saying that people should stay at home except for some limited exceptions. The current advice makes no distinction based on age: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/full-guidance-on-staying-at-home-and-away-from-others/full-guidance-on-staying-at-home-and-away-from-others

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
